page.title: 13RELIGION
page.content: { CHURCH OF ENGLAND:}For many centuries the entire area lay within the large ecclesiastic parish of Great Budworth. The church at Lower Peover, which also serves Plumley, was a chapel of ease of Great Budworth from the 13th century. Some Pickmere residents still travel to worship at St.Mary's, Great Budworth. There is a parish church (date 1845) at Lostock Gralam, and services administered by this parish are held at Wincham, in the former primary school. { ROMAN CATHOLIC:}The nearest Roman Catholic churches are situated at Knutsford and Northwich. { METHODIST:}Pickmere (date 1826), Lostock Green(1835) and Plumley(1887) each have neat brick built Methodist churches, all within the Northwich Circuit, and Stoke on Trent District.
